task.title: Task: Creating a Command Button
task.shortdesc: How to create a command button to run a macro.

taskbody.prereq: To perform this task it is necessary that the macro CellFormat was created.

context.p: A very convenient way to run a macro is by placing a command button on the worksheet.

step.stepresult: The cursor will change to a +. With this cursor you can draw a rectangle in the worksheet for the button.

step.cmd: Click the left mouse button and draw a rectangle with the desired dimensions for the button somewhere in the worksheet. Then release the left mouse button.
step.stepresult:
The drawn rectangle will turn into a button with a text like Button 1. Design button
Design button.
Furthermore you will see the dialog box Assign Macro. Assign macro CellFormat
Assign macro CellFormat

step.cmd: Select the macro CellFormat and click OK.
Select the text on the button and change it to a more appropriate text, for example Cell format.
Deselect the button by clicking anywhere in the worksheet.
Test the macro on a cell with text via the command button.
